summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons administrative detention order for Jeffrey Epstein, dated July 29, 2019, requesting his placement in administrative detention for his own protection pending investigation for a violation of Bureau regulations and a pending SIS investigation. The order indicates Epstein requested admission for protection and that his continued presence in general population poses a serious threat.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the administrative detention order, requesting placement in administrative detention for his own protection at the New York MCC, pending investigation for violation of Bureau regulations and a pending SIS investigation.

events.title: Epstein's Administrative Detention Order
events.description: A Federal Bureau of Prisons administrative detention order is issued for Jeffrey Epstein, requesting his placement in administrative detention for his own protection at the New York MCC, pending investigation for violation of Bureau regulations and a pending SIS investigation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein requested placement in administrative detention for his own protection on July 29, 2019.
Epstein was pending an investigation for a violation of Bureau regulations and a pending SIS investigation at the time of the order.

The order states that Epstein's continued presence in the general population posed a serious threat to life, property, self, staff, other inmates, or to the security or orderly running of the institution.
The document references a pending UDC (Unit Discipline Committee) for Code 228 (Self-Mutilation).
